intro: [WRONG START] Gelonia mindanaense, commonly known as the Mindanao gelonia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and glossy, while its flowers are borne in terminal panicles. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests and secondary growth areas.
